page.title: 04Employment.
page.content: Most of the population of Ashington are employed under the mining industry.The employment figures in 1985 are very low and many families suffer hardship because of this. Those members who are fortunate enough to be employed work in the local NCB coalmines.As this is the main industry many people depend upon it in order to survive.Unemployment is mainly familiar with high school leavers,aged 16 and over because jobs are just simply not available. however,many decide to take up YTS courses in their chosen career at the nearby technical college. Courses range from bricklaying to computer programming and many candidates succeed.Althogh the unemployment situation remains it is being relieved by new complexes being built in Ashington.
